   20: 
   21: -module(fun_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -export([all/0, suite/0,
   24:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   25: 	 bad_apply/1,bad_fun_call/1,badarity/1,ext_badarity/1,
   26:          bad_arglist/1,
   27: 	 equality/1,ordering/1,
   28: 	 fun_to_port/1,t_phash/1,t_phash2/1,md5/1,
   29: 	 refc/1,refc_ets/1,refc_dist/1,
   30: 	 const_propagation/1,t_arity/1,t_is_function2/1,
   31: 	 t_fun_info/1,t_fun_info_mfa/1,t_fun_to_list/1]).
   32: 
   33: -export([nothing/0]).
   34: 
   35: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   36: 
   37: suite() ->
   38:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   39:      {timetrap, {minutes, 1}}].
   40: 
   41: 
   42: all() ->
   43:     [bad_apply, bad_fun_call, badarity, ext_badarity,
   44:      bad_arglist,
   45:      equality, ordering, fun_to_port, t_phash,
   46:      t_phash2, md5, refc, refc_ets, refc_dist,
   47:      const_propagation, t_arity, t_is_function2, t_fun_info,
   48:      t_fun_info_mfa,t_fun_to_list].
   49: 
   50: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   51:     Config.
   52: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   53:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   54: 
   55: 
   56: %% Test that the correct EXIT code is returned for all types of bad funs.
   57: bad_apply(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   58:     bad_apply_fc(42, [0]),
   59:     bad_apply_fc(xx, [1]),
   60:     bad_apply_fc({}, [2]),
   61:     bad_apply_fc({1}, [3]),
   62:     bad_apply_fc({1,2,3}, [4]),
   63:     bad_apply_fc({1,2,3}, [5]),
   64:     bad_apply_fc({1,2,3,4}, [6]),
   65:     bad_apply_fc({1,2,3,4,5,6}, [7]),
   66:     bad_apply_fc({1,2,3,4,5}, [8]),
   67:     bad_apply_badarg({1,2}, [9]),
   68:     ok.
   69: 
   70: bad_apply_fc(Fun, Args) ->
   71:     Res = (catch apply(Fun, Args)),
   72:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
   73:     erlang:yield(),
   74:     case Res of
   75: 	{'EXIT',{{badfun,Fun},_Where}} ->
   76: 	    ok = io:format("apply(~p, ~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res]);
   77: 	Other ->
   78: 	    ok = io:format("apply(~p, ~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res]),
   79: 	    ct:fail({bad_result,Other})
   80:     end.
   81: 
   82: bad_apply_badarg(Fun, Args) ->
   83:     Res = (catch apply(Fun, Args)),
   84:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
   85:     erlang:yield(),
   86:     case Res of
   87: 	{'EXIT',{{badfun,Fun},_Where}} ->
   88: 	    ok = io:format("apply(~p, ~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res]);
   89: 	Other ->
   90: 	    ok = io:format("apply(~p, ~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res]),
   91: 	    ct:fail({bad_result, Other})
   92:     end.
   93: 
   94: %% Try directly calling bad funs.
   95: bad_fun_call(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   96:     bad_call_fc(42),
   97:     bad_call_fc(xx),
   98:     bad_call_fc({}),
   99:     bad_call_fc({1}),
  100:     bad_call_fc({1,2,3}),
  101:     bad_call_fc({1,2,3}),
  102:     bad_call_fc({1,2,3,4}),
  103:     bad_call_fc({1,2,3,4,5,6}),
  104:     bad_call_fc({1,2,3,4,5}),
  105:     bad_call_fc({1,2}),
  106:     ok.
  107: 
  108: bad_call_fc(Fun) ->
  109:     Args = [some,stupid,args],
  110:     Res = (catch Fun(Fun(Args))),
  111:     case Res of
  112: 	{'EXIT',{{badfun,Fun},_Where}} ->
  113: 	    ok = io:format("~p(~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res]);
  114: 	Other ->
  115: 	    ok = io:format("~p(~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res]),
  116: 	    ct:fail({bad_result,Other})
  117:     end.
  118: 
  119: % Test erlang:apply with non-proper arg-list
  120: bad_arglist(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  121:     Fun = fun(A,B) -> A+B end,
  122:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch apply(Fun, 17)),
  123:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch apply(Fun, [17|18])),
  124:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch apply(Fun, [17,18|19])),
  125:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch apply(lists,seq, 17)),
  126:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch apply(lists,seq, [17|18])),
  127:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch apply(lists,seq, [17,18|19])),
  128:     ok.
  129: 
  130: 
  131: %% Call and apply valid funs with wrong number of arguments.
  132: 
  133: badarity(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  134:     Fun = fun() -> ok end,
  135:     Stupid = {stupid,arguments},
  136:     Args = [some,{stupid,arguments},here],
  137: 
  138:     %% Simple call.
  139: 
  140:     Res = (catch Fun(some, Stupid, here)),
  141:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  142:     erlang:yield(),
  143:     case Res of
  144: 	{'EXIT',{{badarity,{Fun,Args}},_}} ->
  145: 	    ok = io:format("~p(~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res]);
  146: 	_ ->
  147: 	    ok = io:format("~p(~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res]),
  148: 	    ct:fail({bad_result,Res})
  149:     end,
  150: 
  151:     %% Apply.
  152: 
  153:     Res2 = (catch apply(Fun, Args)),
  154:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  155:     erlang:yield(),
  156:     case Res2 of
  157: 	{'EXIT',{{badarity,{Fun,Args}},_}} ->
  158: 	    ok = io:format("apply(~p, ~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res2]);
  159: 	_ ->
  160: 	    ok = io:format("apply(~p, ~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res2]),
  161: 	    ct:fail({bad_result,Res2})
  162:     end,
  163:     ok.
  164: 
  165: %% Call and apply valid external funs with wrong number of arguments.
  166: 
  167: ext_badarity(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  168:     Fun = fun ?MODULE:nothing/0,
  169:     Stupid = {stupid,arguments},
  170:     Args = [some,{stupid,arguments},here],
  171: 
  172:     %% Simple call.
  173: 
  174:     Res = (catch Fun(some, Stupid, here)),
  175:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  176:     erlang:yield(),
  177:     case Res of
  178: 	{'EXIT',{{badarity,{Fun,Args}},_}} ->
  179: 	    ok = io:format("~p(~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res]);
  180: 	_ ->
  181: 	    ok = io:format("~p(~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res]),
  182: 	    ct:fail({bad_result,Res})
  183:     end,
  184: 
  185:     %% Apply.
  186: 
  187:     Res2 = (catch apply(Fun, Args)),
  188:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  189:     erlang:yield(),
  190:     case Res2 of
  191: 	{'EXIT',{{badarity,{Fun,Args}},_}} ->
  192: 	    ok = io:format("apply(~p, ~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res2]);
  193: 	_ ->
  194: 	    ok = io:format("apply(~p, ~p) -> ~p\n", [Fun,Args,Res2]),
  195: 	    ct:fail({bad_result,Res2})
  196:     end,
  197:     ok.
  198: 
  199: nothing() ->
  200:     ok.
  201: 
  202: %% Test equality of funs.
  203: 
  204: equality(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  205:     F0 = fun() -> 1 end,
  206:     F0_copy = copy_term(F0),
  207:     true = eq(F0, F0),
  208:     true = eq(F0, F0_copy),
  209: 
  210:     %% Compare different arities.
  211:     F1 = fun(X) -> X + 1 end,
  212:     true = eq(F1, F1),
  213:     false = eq(F0, F1),
  214:     false = eq(F0_copy, F1),
  215: 
  216:     %% Compare different environments.
  217:     G1 = make_fun(1),
  218:     G2 = make_fun(2),
  219:     true = eq(G1, G1),
  220:     true = eq(G2, G2),
  221:     false = eq(G1, G2),
  222:     false = eq(G2, G1),
  223:     G1_copy = copy_term(G1),
  224:     true = eq(G1, G1_copy),
  225: 
  226:     %% Compare fun with binaries.
  227:     B = list_to_binary([7,8,9]),
  228:     false = eq(B, G1),
  229:     false = eq(G1, B),
  230: 
  231:     %% Compare external funs.
  232:     FF0 = fun aa:blurf/0,
  233:     FF0_copy = copy_term(FF0),
  234:     FF1 = fun erlang:abs/0,
  235:     FF2 = fun erlang:exit/1,
  236:     FF3 = fun erlang:exit/2,
  237:     FF4 = fun z:ff/0,
  238: 
  239:     true = eq(FF0, FF0),
  240:     true = eq(FF0, FF0_copy),
  241:     true = eq(FF1, FF1),
  242:     true = eq(FF2, FF2),
  243:     true = eq(FF3, FF3),
  244:     true = eq(FF4, FF4),
  245:     false = eq(FF0, FF1),
  246:     false = eq(FF0, FF2),
  247:     false = eq(FF0, FF3),
  248:     false = eq(FF0, FF4),
  249:     false = eq(FF1, FF0),
  250:     false = eq(FF1, FF2),
  251:     false = eq(FF1, FF3),
  252:     false = eq(FF1, FF4),
  253:     false = eq(FF2, FF3),
  254:     false = eq(FF2, FF4),
  255:     false = eq(FF3, FF4),
  256: 
  257:     %% EEP37
  258:     H1 = fun Fact(N) when N > 0 -> N * Fact(N - 1); Fact(0) -> 1 end,
  259:     H2 = fun Pow(N, M) when M > 0 -> N * Pow(N, M - 1); Pow(_, 0) -> 1 end,
  260:     H1_copy = copy_term(H1),
  261: 
  262:     true = eq(H1, H1),
  263:     true = eq(H1, H1_copy),
  264:     true = eq(H2, H2),
  265:     false = eq(H1, H2),
  266: 
  267:     ok.
  268: 
  269: eq(X, X) -> true;
  270: eq(_, _) -> false.
  271: 
  272: copy_term(Term) ->
  273:     binary_to_term(term_to_binary(Term)).
  274: 
  275: make_fun(X) ->
  276:     fun() -> X end.
  277: 	    
  278: %% Tests ordering of funs.
  279: ordering(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  280:     F1 = make_fun(1, 2),
  281:     F1_copy = copy_term(F1),
  282:     F2 = make_fun(1, 3),
  283:     F3 = make_fun(3, 4),
  284: 
  285:     FF0 = fun aa:blurf/0,
  286:     FF1 = fun erlang:abs/0,
  287:     FF2 = fun erlang:exit/1,
  288:     FF3 = fun erlang:exit/2,
  289:     FF4 = fun z:ff/0,
  290: 
  291:     true = FF0 < FF1,
  292:     true = FF1 < FF2,
  293:     true = FF2 < FF3,
  294:     true = FF3 < FF4,
  295: 
  296:     true = FF0 > F1,
  297:     true = FF0 > F2,
  298:     true = FF0 > F3,
  299:     true = FF4 > F1,
  300:     true = FF4 > F2,
  301:     true = FF4 > F3,
  302: 
  303:     true = F1 == F1,
  304:     true = F1 == F1_copy,
  305:     true = F1 /= F2,
  306: 
  307:     true = F1 < F2,
  308:     true = F2 > F1,
  309:     true = F2 < F3,
  310:     true = F3 > F2,
  311: 
  312:     false = F1 > F2,
  313:     false = F2 > F3,
  314: 
  315:     %% Compare with binaries.
  316: 
  317:     B = list_to_binary([7,8,9,10]),
  318:     false = B == F1,
  319:     false = F1 == B,
  320: 
  321:     true = F1 < B,
  322:     true = B > F2,
  323: 
  324:     false = F1 > B,
  325:     false = B < F2,
  326: 
  327:     false = F1 >= B,
  328:     false = B =< F2,
  329: 
  330:     %% Compare module funs with binaries.
  331:     false = B == FF1,
  332:     false = FF1 == B,
  333: 
  334:     true = FF1 < B,
  335:     true = B > FF2,
  336: 
  337:     false = FF1 > B,
  338:     false = B < FF2,
  339: 
  340:     false = FF1 >= B,
  341:     false = B =< FF2,
  342: 
  343:     %% Create a port and ref.
  344: 
  345:     P = hd(erlang:ports()),
  346:     R = make_ref(),
  347: 
  348:     %% Compare funs with ports and refs.
  349: 
  350:     true = R < F3,
  351:     true = F3 > R,
  352:     true = F3 < P,
  353:     true = P > F3,
  354: 
  355:     true = R =< F3,
  356:     true = F3 >= R,
  357:     true = F3 =< P,
  358:     true = P >= F3,
  359: 
  360:     false = R > F3,
  361:     false = F3 < R,
  362:     false = F3 > P,
  363:     false = P < F3,
  364: 
  365:     %% Compare funs with conses and nils.
  366: 
  367:     true = F1 < [a],
  368:     true = F1 < [],
  369:     true = [a,b] > F1,
  370:     true = [] > F1,
  371: 
  372:     false = [1] < F1,
  373:     false = [] < F1,
  374:     false = F1 > [2],
  375:     false = F1 > [],
  376: 
  377:     false = [1] =< F1,
  378:     false = [] =< F1,
  379:     false = F1 >= [2],
  380:     false = F1 >= [],
  381: 
  382:     %% Compare module funs with conses and nils.
  383: 
  384:     true = FF1 < [a],
  385:     true = FF1 < [],
  386:     true = [a,b] > FF1,
  387:     true = [] > FF1,
  388: 
  389:     false = [1] < FF1,
  390:     false = [] < FF1,
  391:     false = FF1 > [2],
  392:     false = FF1 > [],
  393: 
  394:     false = [1] =< FF1,
  395:     false = [] =< FF1,
  396:     false = FF1 >= [2],
  397:     false = FF1 >= [],
  398:     ok.
  399: 
  400: make_fun(X, Y) ->
  401:     fun(A) -> A*X+Y end.
  402: 
  403: %% Try sending funs to ports (should fail).
  404: fun_to_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  405:     Port = open_port({spawn_executable, os:find_executable("erl")},
  406:                      [{args, ["-noshell", "-eval", "timer:sleep(2000)",
  407:                               "-run", "erlang", "halt"]},
  408:                       use_stdio]),
  409:     fun_to_port(Port, xxx),
  410:     fun_to_port(Port, fun() -> 42 end),
  411:     fun_to_port(Port, [fun() -> 43 end]),
  412:     fun_to_port(Port, [1,fun() -> 44 end]),
  413:     fun_to_port(Port, [0,1|fun() -> 45 end]),
  414:     B64K = build_io_list(65536),
  415:     fun_to_port(Port, [B64K,fun() -> 45 end]),
  416:     fun_to_port(Port, [B64K|fun() -> 45 end]),
  417:     unlink(Port),
  418:     exit(Port, kill),
  419:     ok.
  420: 
  421: fun_to_port(Port, IoList) ->
  422:     case catch port_command(Port, IoList) of
  423: 	{'EXIT',{badarg,_}} -> ok;
  424: 	Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_retval,Other})
  425:     end.
  426: 
  427: build_io_list(0) -> [];
  428: build_io_list(1) -> [7];
  429: build_io_list(N) ->
  430:     L = build_io_list(N div 2),
  431:     case N rem 2 of
  432: 	0 -> [L|L];
  433: 	1 -> [7,L|L]
  434:     end.
  435: 
  436: %% Test the phash/2 BIF on funs.
  437: t_phash(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  438:     F1 = fun(_X) -> 1 end,
  439:     F2 = fun(_X) -> 2 end,
  440:     true = phash(F1) /= phash(F2),
  441: 
  442:     G1 = make_fun(1, 2, 3),
  443:     G2 = make_fun(1, 2, 3),
  444:     G3 = make_fun(1, 2, 4),
  445:     true = phash(G1) == phash(G2),
  446:     true = phash(G2) /= phash(G3),
  447: 
  448:     FF0 = fun erlang:abs/1,
  449:     FF1 = fun erlang:exit/1,
  450:     FF2 = fun erlang:exit/2,
  451:     FF3 = fun blurf:exit/2,
  452:     true = phash(FF0) =/= phash(FF1),
  453:     true = phash(FF0) =/= phash(FF2),
  454:     true = phash(FF0) =/= phash(FF3),
  455:     true = phash(FF1) =/= phash(FF2),
  456:     true = phash(FF1) =/= phash(FF3),
  457:     true = phash(FF2) =/= phash(FF3),
  458:     ok.
  459: 
  460: phash(Term) ->
  461:     erlang:phash(Term, 16#7ffffff).
  462: 
  463: %% Test the phash2/2 BIF on funs.
  464: t_phash2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  465:     F1 = fun(_X) -> 1 end,
  466:     F2 = fun(_X) -> 2 end,
  467:     true = phash2(F1) /= phash2(F2),
  468: 
  469:     G1 = make_fun(1, 2, 3),
  470:     G2 = make_fun(1, 2, 3),
  471:     G3 = make_fun(1, 2, 4),
  472:     true = phash2(G1) == phash2(G2),
  473:     true = phash2(G2) /= phash2(G3),
  474: 
  475:     FF0 = fun erlang:abs/1,
  476:     FF1 = fun erlang:exit/1,
  477:     FF2 = fun erlang:exit/2,
  478:     FF3 = fun blurf:exit/2,
  479:     true = phash2(FF0) =/= phash2(FF1),
  480:     true = phash2(FF0) =/= phash2(FF2),
  481:     true = phash2(FF0) =/= phash2(FF3),
  482:     true = phash2(FF1) =/= phash2(FF2),
  483:     true = phash2(FF1) =/= phash2(FF3),
  484:     true = phash2(FF2) =/= phash2(FF3),
  485:     
  486:     ok.
  487: 
  488: phash2(Term) ->
  489:     erlang:phash2(Term, 16#7ffffff).
  490: 
  491: make_fun(X, Y, Z) ->
  492:     fun() -> {X,Y,Z} end.
  493: 
  494: %% Test that MD5 bifs reject funs properly.
  495: md5(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  496:     _ = size(erlang:md5_init()),
  497: 
  498:     %% Try funs in the i/o list.
  499:     bad_md5(fun(_X) -> 42 end),
  500:     bad_md5([fun(_X) -> 43 end]),
  501:     bad_md5([1,fun(_X) -> 44 end]),
  502:     bad_md5([1|fun(_X) -> 45 end]),
  503:     B64K = build_io_list(65536),
  504:     bad_md5([B64K,fun(_X) -> 46 end]),
  505:     bad_md5([B64K|fun(_X) -> 46 end]),
  506:     ok.
  507:     
  508: bad_md5(Bad) ->
  509:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:md5(Bad)).
  510: 
  511: refc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  512:     %% As the fun entry is owned by the fun's shared reference holder and not
  513:     %% the fun itself, its reference count should be generally be unchanged
  514:     %% regardless of how many copies we create, and on which process we do so.
  515:     %%
  516:     %% Only certain operations that break the sharing of the literal reference
  517:     %% holder should have an impact.
  518:     F1 = fun_factory(2),
  519:     {refc,2} = erlang:fun_info(F1, refc),
  520:     F2 = fun_factory(42),
  521:     {refc,2} = erlang:fun_info(F1, refc),
  522: 
  523:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  524:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> {refc,2} = erlang:fun_info(F1, refc) end),
  525:     receive
  526: 	{'EXIT',Pid,normal} -> ok;
  527: 	Other -> ct:fail({unexpected,Other})
  528:     end,
  529:     process_flag(trap_exit, false),
  530:     %% Wait to make sure that the process has terminated completely.
  531:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
  532:     {refc,2} = erlang:fun_info(F1, refc),
  533: 
  534:     %% Force a copy of the underlying reference holder by passing through the
  535:     %% external term format.
  536:     F3 = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(F1)),
  537:     3 = fun_refc(F1),
  538:     3 = fun_refc(F3),
  539: 
  540:     %% Garbage collect. Only the F2 fun will be left.
  541:     7 = F1(5),
  542:     true = erlang:garbage_collect(),
  543:     40 = F2(-2),
  544:     {refc,2} = erlang:fun_info(F2, refc),
  545: 
  546:     ok.
  547: 
  548: fun_factory(Const) ->
  549:     fun(X) -> X + Const end.
  550: 
  551: refc_ets(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  552:     F = fun(X) -> X + 33 end,
  553:     {refc,2} = erlang:fun_info(F, refc),
  554: 
  555:     refc_ets_set(F, [set]),
  556:     refc_ets_set(F, [ordered_set]),
  557:     refc_ets_bag(F, [bag]),
  558:     refc_ets_bag(F, [duplicate_bag]),
  559:     ok.
  560: 
  561: refc_ets_set(F1, Options) ->
  562:     io:format("~p", [Options]),
  563:     Tab = ets:new(kalle, Options),
  564:     true = ets:insert(Tab, {a_key,F1}),
  565:     3 = fun_refc(F1),
  566:     [{a_key,F3}] = ets:lookup(Tab, a_key),
  567:     4 = fun_refc(F1),
  568:     true = ets:insert(Tab, {a_key,not_a_fun}),
  569:     3 = fun_refc(F1),
  570:     true = ets:insert(Tab, {another_key,F1}),
  571:     4 = fun_refc(F1),
  572:     true = ets:delete(Tab),
  573:     3 = fun_refc(F1),
  574:     10 = F3(-23),
  575:     true = erlang:garbage_collect(),
  576:     2 = fun_refc(F1),
  577:     ok.
  578: 
  579: refc_ets_bag(F1, Options) ->
  580:     io:format("~p", [Options]),
  581:     Tab = ets:new(kalle, Options),
  582:     true = ets:insert(Tab, {a_key,F1}),
  583:     3 = fun_refc(F1),
  584:     [{a_key,F3}] = ets:lookup(Tab, a_key),
  585:     4 = fun_refc(F1),
  586:     true = ets:insert(Tab, {a_key,not_a_fun}),
  587:     4 = fun_refc(F1),
  588:     true = ets:insert(Tab, {another_key,F1}),
  589:     5 = fun_refc(F1),
  590:     true = ets:delete(Tab),
  591:     3 = fun_refc(F1),
  592:     10 = F3(-23),
  593:     true = erlang:garbage_collect(),
  594:     2 = fun_refc(F1),
  595:     ok.
  596: 
  597: refc_dist(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  598:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  599:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  600:     Pid = spawn_link(Node, fun() -> receive
  601:                                         Fun when is_function(Fun) ->
  602:                                             3 = fun_refc(Fun),
  603:                                             exit({normal,Fun}) end
  604:                            end),
  605:     F = fun() -> 42 end,
  606:     2 = fun_refc(F),
  607:     Pid ! F,
  608:     F2 = receive
  609: 	     {'EXIT',Pid,{normal,Fun}} -> Fun;
  610: 	     Other -> ct:fail({unexpected,Other})
  611: 	 end,
  612:     %% dist.c:net_mess2 have a reference to Fun for a while since
  613:     %% Fun is passed in an exit signal. Wait until it is gone.
  614:     wait_until(fun () -> 4 =/= fun_refc(F2) end),
  615:     3 = fun_refc(F2),
  616:     true = erlang:garbage_collect(),
  617:     2 = fun_refc(F),
  618:     refc_dist_send(Node, F),
  619:     peer:stop(Peer).
  620: 
  621: refc_dist_send(Node, F) ->
  622:     Pid = spawn_link(Node, fun() -> receive
  623:                                         {To,Fun} when is_function(Fun) ->
  624:                                             wait_until(fun () ->
  625:                                                                3 =:= fun_refc(Fun)
  626:                                                        end),
  627:                                             To ! Fun
  628:                                     end
  629:                            end),
  630:     2 = fun_refc(F),
  631:     Pid ! {self(),F},
  632:     F2 = receive
  633: 	     Fun when is_function(Fun) -> Fun;
  634: 	     Other -> ct:fail({unexpected,Other})
  635: 	 end,
  636:     receive {'EXIT',Pid,normal} -> ok end,
  637:     %% No reference from dist.c:net_mess2 since Fun is passed
  638:     %% in an ordinary message.
  639:     3 = fun_refc(F),
  640:     3 = fun_refc(F2),
  641:     refc_dist_reg_send(Node, F).
  642: 
  643: refc_dist_reg_send(Node, F) ->
  644:     true = erlang:garbage_collect(),
  645:     2 = fun_refc(F),
  646:     Ref = make_ref(),
  647:     Me = self(),
  648:     Pid = spawn_link(Node, fun() ->
  649:                                    true = register(my_fun_tester, self()),
  650:                                    Me ! Ref,
  651:                                    receive
  652:                                        {Me,Fun} when is_function(Fun) ->
  653:                                            3 = fun_refc(Fun),
  654:                                            Me ! Fun
  655:                                    end
  656:                            end),
  657:     erlang:yield(),
  658:     2 = fun_refc(F),
  659:     receive Ref -> ok end,
  660:     {my_fun_tester,Node} ! {self(),F},
  661:     F2 = receive
  662: 	     Fun when is_function(Fun) -> Fun;
  663: 	     Other -> ct:fail({unexpected,Other})
  664: 	 end,
  665:     receive {'EXIT',Pid,normal} -> ok end,
  666: 
  667:     3 = fun_refc(F),
  668:     3 = fun_refc(F2),
  669:     ok.
  670:     
  671: fun_refc(F) ->
  672:     {refc,Count} = erlang:fun_info(F, refc),
  673:     Count.
  674: 
  675: const_propagation(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  676:     Fun1 = fun wait_until/1,
  677:     2 = fun_refc(Fun1),
  678:     Fun2 = Fun1,
  679:     my_cmp({Fun1,Fun2}),
  680: 
  681:     Fun3 = fun() -> ok end,
  682:     2 = fun_refc(Fun3),
  683:     Fun4 = Fun3,
  684:     my_cmp({Fun3,Fun4}),
  685:     ok.
  686: 
  687: my_cmp({Fun,Fun}) -> ok;
  688: my_cmp({Fun1,Fun2}) ->
  689:     io:format("Fun1: ~p", [erlang:fun_info(Fun1)]),
  690:     io:format("Fun2: ~p", [erlang:fun_info(Fun2)]),
  691:     ct:fail(no_match).
  692: 
  693: t_arity(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  694:     0 = fun_arity(fun() -> ok end),
  695:     0 = fun_arity(fun() -> Config end),
  696:     1 = fun_arity(fun(X) -> X+1 end),
  697:     1 = fun_arity(fun(X) -> Config =:= X end),
  698:     A = id(42),
  699: 
  700:     %% Test that the arity is transferred properly.
  701:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  702:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  703:     hello_world = spawn_call(Node, fun() -> hello_world end),
  704:     0 = spawn_call(Node, fun(X) -> X end),
  705:     42 = spawn_call(Node, fun(_X) -> A end),
  706:     43 = spawn_call(Node, fun(X, Y) -> A+X+Y end),
  707:     1 = spawn_call(Node, fun(X, Y) -> X+Y end),
  708:     45 = spawn_call(Node, fun(X, Y, Z) -> A+X+Y+Z end),
  709:     peer:stop(Peer),
  710:     ok.
  711: 
  712: t_is_function2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  713:     false = is_function(id({a,b}), 0),
  714:     false = is_function(id({a,b}), 234343434333433433),
  715:     true = is_function(id(fun() -> ok end), 0),
  716:     true = is_function(id(fun(_) -> ok end), 1),
  717:     false = is_function(id(fun(_) -> ok end), 0),
  718: 
  719:     true = is_function(id(fun erlang:abs/1), 1),
  720:     true = is_function(id(fun erlang:abs/99), 99),
  721:     false = is_function(id(fun erlang:abs/1), 0),
  722:     false = is_function(id(fun erlang:abs/99), 0),
  723: 
  724:     false = is_function(id(self()), 0),
  725:     false = is_function(id({a,b,c}), 0),
  726:     false = is_function(id({a}), 0),
  727:     false = is_function(id([a,b,c]), 0),
  728: 
  729:     %% Larger arities.
  730:     F16 = id(fun f/16),
  731:     F255 = id(fun f/255),
  732: 
  733:     false = is_function(id(self()), 16),
  734:     true = is_function(F16, 16),
  735:     ok = id(if is_function(F16, 16) -> ok; true -> error end),
  736:     false = is_function(F255, 16),
  737:     error = id(if is_function(F255, 16) -> ok; true -> error end),
  738: 
  739:     false = is_function(id(self()), 255),
  740:     true = is_function(F255, 255),
  741:     false = is_function(F16, 255),
  742:     error = id(if is_function(F16, 255) -> ok; true -> error end),
  743:     ok = id(if is_function(F255, 255) -> ok; true -> error end),
  744: 
  745:     %% Bad arity argument.
  746:     bad_arity(a),
  747:     bad_arity(-1),
  748:     bad_arity(-9738974938734938793873498378),
  749:     bad_arity([]),
  750:     bad_arity(fun() -> ok end),
  751:     bad_arity({}),
  752:     bad_arity({a,b}),
  753:     bad_arity(self()),
  754: 
  755:     %% Bad arity argument in guard test.
  756:     Fun = id(fun erlang:abs/1),
  757:     ok = if
  758:              is_function(Fun, -1) -> error;
  759:              is_function(Fun, 256) -> error;
  760:              is_function(Fun, a) -> error;
  761:              is_function(Fun, Fun) -> error;
  762:              true -> ok
  763:          end,
  764:     ok.
  765: 
  766: f(_A1, _A2, _A3, _A4, _A5, _A6, _A7, _A8,
  767:   _A9, _A10, _A11, _A12, _A13, _A14, _A15, _A16) ->
  768:     ok.
  769: 
  770: f(_A1, _A2, _A3, _A4, _A5, _A6, _A7, _A8,
  771:   _A9, _A10, _A11, _A12, _A13, _A14, _A15, _A16,
  772:   _A17, _A18, _A19, _A20, _A21, _A22, _A23, _A24,
  773:   _A25, _A26, _A27, _A28, _A29, _A30, _A31, _A32,
  774:   _A33, _A34, _A35, _A36, _A37, _A38, _A39, _A40,
  775:   _A41, _A42, _A43, _A44, _A45, _A46, _A47, _A48,
  776:   _A49, _A50, _A51, _A52, _A53, _A54, _A55, _A56,
  777:   _A57, _A58, _A59, _A60, _A61, _A62, _A63, _A64,
  778:   _A65, _A66, _A67, _A68, _A69, _A70, _A71, _A72,
  779:   _A73, _A74, _A75, _A76, _A77, _A78, _A79, _A80,
  780:   _A81, _A82, _A83, _A84, _A85, _A86, _A87, _A88,
  781:   _A89, _A90, _A91, _A92, _A93, _A94, _A95, _A96,
  782:   _A97, _A98, _A99, _A100, _A101, _A102, _A103, _A104,
  783:   _A105, _A106, _A107, _A108, _A109, _A110, _A111, _A112,
  784:   _A113, _A114, _A115, _A116, _A117, _A118, _A119, _A120,
  785:   _A121, _A122, _A123, _A124, _A125, _A126, _A127, _A128,
  786:   _A129, _A130, _A131, _A132, _A133, _A134, _A135, _A136,
  787:   _A137, _A138, _A139, _A140, _A141, _A142, _A143, _A144,
  788:   _A145, _A146, _A147, _A148, _A149, _A150, _A151, _A152,
  789:   _A153, _A154, _A155, _A156, _A157, _A158, _A159, _A160,
  790:   _A161, _A162, _A163, _A164, _A165, _A166, _A167, _A168,
  791:   _A169, _A170, _A171, _A172, _A173, _A174, _A175, _A176,
  792:   _A177, _A178, _A179, _A180, _A181, _A182, _A183, _A184,
  793:   _A185, _A186, _A187, _A188, _A189, _A190, _A191, _A192,
  794:   _A193, _A194, _A195, _A196, _A197, _A198, _A199, _A200,
  795:   _A201, _A202, _A203, _A204, _A205, _A206, _A207, _A208,
  796:   _A209, _A210, _A211, _A212, _A213, _A214, _A215, _A216,
  797:   _A217, _A218, _A219, _A220, _A221, _A222, _A223, _A224,
  798:   _A225, _A226, _A227, _A228, _A229, _A230, _A231, _A232,
  799:   _A233, _A234, _A235, _A236, _A237, _A238, _A239, _A240,
  800:   _A241, _A242, _A243, _A244, _A245, _A246, _A247, _A248,
  801:   _A249, _A250, _A251, _A252, _A253, _A254, _A255) ->
  802:     ok.
  803: 
  804: bad_arity(A) ->
  805:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch is_function(fun() -> ok end, A)),
  806:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch is_function(no_fun, A)),
  807:     ok.
  808: 
  809: t_fun_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  810:     F = fun t_fun_info/1,
  811:     try F(blurf) of
  812: 	      FAny ->
  813: 		  ct:fail("should fail; returned ~p\n", [FAny])
  814: 	  catch
  815: 	      error:function_clause -> ok
  816: 	  end,
  817:     {module,?MODULE} = erlang:fun_info(F, module),
  818:     case erlang:fun_info(F, name) of
  819: 	      undefined ->
  820: 		  ct:fail(no_fun_info);
  821: 	      _ -> ok
  822: 	  end,
  823:     {arity,1} = erlang:fun_info(F, arity),
  824:     {env,[]} = erlang:fun_info(F, env),
  825:     verify_not_undef(F, index),
  826:     verify_not_undef(F, uniq),
  827:     verify_not_undef(F, new_index),
  828:     verify_not_undef(F, new_uniq),
  829:     verify_not_undef(F, refc),
  830:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch erlang:fun_info(F, blurf)),    
  831: 
  832:     %% Module fun.
  833:     FF = fun ?MODULE:t_fun_info/1,
  834:     try FF(blurf) of
  835: 	      FFAny ->
  836: 		  ct:fail("should fail; returned ~p\n", [FFAny])
  837: 	  catch
  838: 	      error:function_clause -> ok
  839: 	  end,
  840: 
  841:     {module,?MODULE} = erlang:fun_info(FF, module),
  842:     {name,t_fun_info} = erlang:fun_info(FF, name),
  843:     {arity,1} = erlang:fun_info(FF, arity),
  844:     {env,[]} = erlang:fun_info(FF, env),
  845:     verify_undef(FF, index),
  846:     verify_undef(FF, uniq),
  847:     verify_undef(FF, new_index),
  848:     verify_undef(FF, new_uniq),
  849:     verify_undef(FF, refc),
  850:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch erlang:fun_info(FF, blurf)),
  851: 
  852:     %% Not fun.
  853:     bad_info(abc),
  854:     bad_info(42),
  855:     bad_info({fun erlang:list_to_integer/1}),
  856:     bad_info([42]),
  857:     bad_info([]),
  858:     bad_info(self()),
  859:     bad_info(<<>>),
  860:     bad_info(<<1,2>>),
  861:     ok.
  862: 
  863: t_fun_info_mfa(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  864:     Fun1 = fun spawn_call/2,
  865:     {module,M1}  = erlang:fun_info(Fun1, module),
  866:     {name,F1}    = erlang:fun_info(Fun1, name),
  867:     {arity,A1}   = erlang:fun_info(Fun1, arity),
  868:     {M1,F1,A1=2} = erlang:fun_info_mfa(Fun1),
  869:     %% Module fun.
  870:     Fun2 = fun ?MODULE:t_fun_info/1,
  871:     {module,M2}  = erlang:fun_info(Fun2, module),
  872:     {name,F2}    = erlang:fun_info(Fun2, name),
  873:     {arity,A2}   = erlang:fun_info(Fun2, arity),
  874:     {M2,F2,A2=1} = erlang:fun_info_mfa(Fun2),
  875: 
  876:     %% Not fun.
  877:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch erlang:fun_info_mfa(id(d))),
  878:     ok.
  879: 
  880: t_fun_to_list(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  881:     "fun a:b/1" = erlang:fun_to_list(fun a:b/1),
  882:     "fun 'a-esc':'b-esc'/1" = erlang:fun_to_list(fun 'a-esc':'b-esc'/1),
  883:     "fun 'a-esc':b/1" = erlang:fun_to_list(fun 'a-esc':b/1),
  884:     "fun a:'b-esc'/1" = erlang:fun_to_list(fun a:'b-esc'/1),
  885:     ok.
  886: 
  887: bad_info(Term) ->
  888:     try	erlang:fun_info(Term, module) of
  889: 	Any ->
  890: 	    ict:fail("should fail; returned ~p\n", [Any])
  891:     catch
  892: 	error:badarg -> ok
  893:     end.
  894: 
  895: verify_undef(Fun, Tag) ->
  896:     {Tag,undefined} = erlang:fun_info(Fun, Tag).
  897: 
  898: verify_not_undef(Fun, Tag) ->
  899:     case erlang:fun_info(Fun, Tag) of
  900: 	{Tag,undefined} ->
  901: 	    ct:fail("tag ~w not defined in fun_info", [Tag]);
  902: 	{Tag,_} -> ok
  903:     end.
  904: 
  905: id(X) ->
  906:     X.
  907: 
  908: spawn_call(Node, AFun) ->
  909:     Self = self(),
  910:     Pid = spawn_link(Node,
  911: 		     fun() ->
  912: 			     receive
  913: 				 {Fun,Fun,Fun} when is_function(Fun) ->
  914: 				     Arity = fun_arity(Fun),
  915: 				     Args = case Arity of
  916: 						0 -> [];
  917: 						_ -> lists:seq(0, Arity-1)
  918: 					    end,
  919: 				     Res = apply(Fun, Args),
  920:                                      Self ! {result,Res}
  921: 			     end
  922: 		     end),
  923:     Pid ! {AFun,AFun,AFun},
  924:     Res = receive
  925: 	      {result,R} -> R;
  926: 	      Other -> ct:fail({bad_message,Other})
  927: 	  after 10000 ->
  928: 		  ct:fail(timeout_waiting_for_result)
  929: 	  end,
  930:     receive
  931: 	{'EXIT',Pid,normal} -> ok;
  932: 	Other2 -> ct:fail({bad_message_waiting_for_exit,Other2})
  933:     after 10000 ->
  934: 	    ct:fail(timeout_waiting_for_exit)
  935:     end,
  936:     Res.
  937: 
  938: fun_arity(F) ->
  939:     {arity,Arity} = erlang:fun_info(F, arity),
  940:     Arity.
  941: 
  942: wait_until(Fun) ->
  943:     case catch Fun() of
  944: 	true -> ok;
  945: 	_ -> receive after 100 -> wait_until(Fun) end
  946:     end.
